medical_history.chief_complaint: Severe mental retardation, hearing loss, and recurrent upper respiratory tract infections.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began at 9 months of age with delayed neuropsychomotor development attributed to infantile febrile convulsions. Recently, he presented with severe symptoms including dysphasia, difficulty in walking, and dystonic movements.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Graves disease diagnosed at age 21, initial treatment with 131I. Has a history of infantile febrile convulsions.
medical_history.family_history: Proband's mother has slightly elevated TSH with normal total T3 and T4 levels, and she shows autoimmune thyroid disease. Other family members have varied thyroid function test results indicating potential genetic thyroid conditions.
